info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Tallahatchie, southeastern Quitman and southwestern Panola Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 545 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marks, or 17 miles east of Clarksdale, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marks, Lambert, Crowder, Curtis Station, Belen, Darling, West Marks, Mims, Riverview, Asa, Hinchcliff, Locke Station, Essex and Chapeltown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
